poem:
"A Drift in Isfahan"

Red dawn over Isfahan, drone
scribbles in silent 
sky, so much depends on 
the unseen wings, fire-borne.

Where old rules lay bare,
broken, on soil and sand,
As bird and cloud conspire,
men's hearts tremble in hand. 

A city cradles in its palm
nuclear pulse, like a tender blossom,
In the game of gods and drones,
Isfahan finds no ransom.
